H0.text: The total amount of energy varies throughout the conversion.

H1.text: Increases because some energy is created is the total amount of energy when one form of energy is converted into other forms of energy.

H2.text: The total amount of energy remains constant throughout the conversion when one form of energy is converted into other forms of energy.

H3.text: The total amount of energy decreases because some energy is destroyed when one form of energy is converted into other forms.

A4.text: Energy can neither be created nor destroyed; rather, it can only be transformed or transferred from one form to another.

A5.text: The principle says that the total amount of energy within the system can only be changed through energy entering or leaving the system.
